title: American_Top_40_1987_October_10th
description:
"The numbers get smaller and the hits get bigger."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Huey Lewis And The News are in the countdown with their fifth top ten hit from the album "Fore" - "Doing It All For My Baby."

Casey remembers actor (and recording artist?) Lorne Greene.

Casey counts down the top ten show-business moneymakers of 1986-1987 according to Forbes Magazine, and the man in third place has a song in the countdown.

A listener wants to know, "In chart history, what has been the most common last name of acts hitting number one?" Casey says the last name is shared by Tex, Roger, Andy, Maurice, and Denice.

There is a band in the countdown that once checked into a hotel, and decided to play a practical joke on their tour manager which included 29 live chickens. Casey tells the story.

One song in the countdown is a remake of a song by Tommy James and the Shondells. It was originally on the chart four years before the artist who currently sings it was even born.

The woman who holds the record for most number one hits in the 80's (as of this countdown) has a song on the chart.

We hear details about the conspiracy theory that Beatle Paul McCartney was dead. Casey even plays a Beatles song backwards for us to hear.
